title: Science Education Curriculum Utilizing 21st-Century Learning Skills and Postmodern Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Designed for in-service secondary science teachers to integrate 21st-century learning skills into science classes. Emphasizes real-time collaboration and self-directed learning in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to solve problems by utilizing information literacy and digital communication tools in science classes.
Design science inquiry activities applying postmodern instructional design principles (non-linearity, openness, multiple interpretations).

Based on peer feedback (at least twice) and self-assessment (weekly), learners will establish self-directed learning plans including specific goals (e.g., "complete three programming basics modules") on a four-week basis, achieve over 80% execution rates, and submit plan adjustment reports if necessary.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
